div.head: 傷寒結胸
div.div: bound chest following harm caused by cold

bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

entry.def: bound chest following harm caused by cold

sense.def: Pathological Condition identical with jie xiong 結胸 , bound [qi in the] chest. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 7: 傷寒 結胸候：結胸者，謂熱毒結聚於心胸也。此由病發於陽，而早下之，熱 氣乘虛而痞結不散也。按之痛，其脈寸口浮，關上反自沉是也 , “Signs of bound chest following harm caused by cold : bound [qi in the] chest, that is to say: heat poison forms nodular collections in the heart and chest. The reason is that the disease originates in the yang [conduits], and is purged early on. The heat qi avails itself of the depletion, and forms obstacle-illness nodes that fail to dissipate. If pressed they ache. The accompanying [movement in the] vessels at the inch-opening is at the surface, and contrary [to normal] it is deep inside above the gate-section”.
